senses.de: The money a person earns from their job, often paid each month
senses.ex: She gets a good salary working as a nurse.

Tips.title: Regular Payment
Tips.description: Understand that 'salary' implies a set amount received regularly, usually monthly.
Tips.example: My salary is deposited into my bank account on the last working day each month.

Tips.title: Annual Calculations
Tips.description: Salaries are often discussed annually to compare jobs or negotiate pay.
Tips.example: The job offer listed a salary of $50,000 per year.

Tips.title: Not Hourly Rate
Tips.description: Unlike wages, 'salary' isn't based on the exact number of hours worked.
Tips.example: Even if I work overtime, my salary remains the same.

senses.de: A specific amount of money that a person earns in exchange for the work they do, regardless of the number of hours they work
senses.ex: He is on a salary, so he gets paid the same amount each month no matter how many hours he works.

Tips.title: Fixed Income
Tips.description: Salary stays constant regardless of hours, emphasizing job stability.
Tips.example: With my salary, I can plan my finances, as I earn a fixed amount each month.

Tips.title: Beyond Hours
Tips.description: Remember, a salary covers a job's overall value, not just time spent working.
Tips.example: His creativity and skills contribute to his salary, not just the hours he logs.

Tips.title: Job Position
Tips.description: Higher job positions tend to have salaries rather than hourly wages.
Tips.example: After her promotion, she moved from an hourly wage to a salary.

senses.de: The total amount of money listed in a person's contract of employment before tax or other charges are deducted
senses.ex: His salary before taxes is $75,000 per year.

Tips.title: Pre-deduction Amount
Tips.description: Salary in legal or job contracts is the amount before taxes or deductions.
Tips.example: My contract states a salary of $3,000 a month, but that's before taxes.

Tips.title: Contract Basis
Tips.description: The salary in legal contexts is a guarantee in your employment contract.
Tips.example: Her salary is set in her contract and cannot be changed without her agreement.

Tips.title: Negotiable Term
Tips.description: When job hunting or getting promoted, remember the salary is often negotiable.
Tips.example: During the interview, he negotiated his starting salary up by $5,000.

Compensation.wordDefinition:
Compensation is a broader term that includes everything an employee receives in exchange for their work, such as salary, benefits, bonuses, and incentives.

In other words, salary is a type of compensation, but compensation includes more than just salary.

Compensation can be applicable in discussions of employee benefits and rewards more generally, while salary is specifically the predetermined amount that an employee will be paid for their work.

Earnings.wordDefinition:
Earnings refer to all the money you make from working, including your salary, bonuses, and any tips or commissions you earn.

Earnings are a broader term that includes salary as well as other forms of income from work.

Emolument.wordDefinition:
Emolument refers to any financial compensation, including benefits, that is received by an individual in exchange for work or services rendered.

Salary is a specific form of emolument that refers to the fixed amount of money paid to an employee on a regular basis for their work.

The main difference between these terms is that emolument is a broader term that encompasses all forms of financial compensation, while salary refers specifically to a fixed amount paid to an employee on a regular basis.

Income.wordDefinition:
Income refers to all the money a person receives in a year, including wages, tips, interest earned on savings, royalties, and any other form of payment.

So, while salary is a part of a person's income, income is a much broader term that includes all sources of money earned.

Income can apply to anyone who earns money, such as a self-employed person or someone who earns income from investments.

Pay.wordDefinition:
Pay generally refers to the amount of money you receive for doing work, such as an hourly rate or a price for a specific job.

Salary specifically refers to the money you receive on a regular basis for a certain job or position, typically paid on a monthly or yearly basis.

Pay can be variable depending on how much work you do or how many hours you work, while salary is a fixed amount that is agreed upon in your employment contract.

Remunerate.wordDefinition:
Remunerate and salary are both related to payment for work or services, but they are used in different contexts.

Remunerate refers to any form of payment made to someone for their work or services, whether in the form of money, goods, or services.

Remunerate refers to any form of payment for work, while salary specifically refers to a fixed payment amount paid regularly to an employee.

Stipend.wordDefinition:
A stipend is a fixed sum of money paid to someone to cover their expenses or as an allowance.

It is often provided to interns, trainees, or students to cover their living or educational expenses. Stipends are applicable in educational, research, or religious organizations.

In simpler terms, a salary is your regular pay for working at a job, whereas a stipend is a payment or allowance given to cover specific expenses or for participating in a particular activity.

Wage.wordDefinition:
Salary and wage refer to the money that a person earns for their work. The main difference is in how they are calculated and when they are paid.

A wage is usually paid on an hourly basis, and the amount earned depends on the number of hours worked. For example, if someone works for $15 per hour and works for 8 hours in a day, they will earn $120 for that day.

In general, salaries are more commonly used for professional or management-level positions, while wages are more commonly used for jobs that require manual labor or hourly work.

quotes.Text: Baseball, in my opinion, would be a lot better if you could just make the same salary as everybody else in the world, and you don't deal with any of the other stuff. But that's not how it is. The main thing is I want to pitch against the best players in the world, and you can't do that playing in a pickup baseball league in your town.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Zack Greinke

quotes.Text: In my barrio, jobs work and money saves lives. When I have had the funds to place a gang member on a job site and pay his salary, I've seen him stop banging. When, on the rarest of occasions, an employer has offered a job to one of these youth, I've witnessed kids suddenly have a reason to get up in the morning.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Greg Boyle

quotes.Text: I can't apply $3 billion in capital to the tech industry. It wouldn't work. But in infrastructure, education, I can make a real difference. I can change someone's life, for the better, permanently. If I can improve a kid's education, I can increase their salary later on and for decades.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Dustin Moskovitz

quotes.Text: Don't stay at the job for safe salary increases over time. That will never get you where you want - freedom from financial worry. Only free time, imagination, creativity, and an ability to disappear will help you deliver value that nobody ever delivered before in the history of mankind.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: James Altucher

quotes.Text: I just believe that the way that young people's minds develop is fascinating. If you are doing something for a grade or salary or a reward, it doesn't have as much meaning as creating something for yourself and your own life.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Wozniak

quotes.Text: When an actor comes to me and wants to discuss his character, I say, 'It's in the script.' If he says, 'But what's my motivation?, ' I say, 'Your salary.
quotes.Title: English Director
quotes.Name: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.Text: Asking what I considered an impossible salary when I didn't want to work for someone has boosted my pay again and again.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ethel Waters

quotes.Text: Italian sides will find it hard to attract the world's top players while there is a salary cap.
quotes.Title: English Athlete
quotes.Name: Eniola Aluko

quotes.Text: The U.K. is one of the few places in the world that has final salary pensions.
quotes.Title: British Businessman
quotes.Name: Jim Ratcliffe

quotes.Text: It wouldn't be the worst thing in the world if we didn't have a salary cap.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jerry Jones
